meanings.definition: Blood poisoning caused by bacterial toxins.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with toxemia after finding bacterial toxins in their blood.
meanings.sent2: Toxemia can be a serious condition if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria threw a party in the blood, causing toxemia to spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent4: The toxins in his blood turned into little troublemakers, leading to a toxemia outbreak.
meanings.sent5: The image of bacterial toxins invading the bloodstream stuck with her as a vivid example of toxemia.

meanings.definition: A condition in which toxins are present in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The presence of toxins in the blood indicated toxemia in the patient.
meanings.sent2: Toxemia can occur when the body is unable to eliminate toxins effectively.
meanings.sent3: The toxins in the blood decided to have a dance party, causing a case of toxemia.
meanings.sent4: His bloodstream became a toxic wasteland, a perfect environment for toxemia to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The idea of toxins roaming freely in the blood painted a clear picture of toxemia in her mind.
